Articles.Content: So I have not played much 1.1+, but I notice there's no more KSP.log being created? And what are the .pdb files?... I havent seen .pdbs since my Palm device days...
Try a complete reinstall maybe? And if you're using steam,. do a cache verification.
If you unzipped KSP to a protected Windows folder it will not have write permissions for that folder, and your KSP.log will be somewhere in C:\users\application data\

On 5/2/2016 at 6:56 AM, sal_vager said:

If you unzipped KSP to a protected Windows folder it will not have write permissions for that folder, and your KSP.log will be somewhere in C:\users\application data\

Came to add that I also am not getting a settings.cfg OR any output_log.txts created, and also saw your post...
Nope... I already had checked all that, thinking the same... Also, my KSP installs are on a separate partition from my C:\ anyway...
I even redownloaded the install package from the KSP website yesterday, just to make sure I had gotten the correct one in the 1st place... \o/

I guess what I really need to know is if I am the only one this is happening to...

Edited May 3, 2016 by Stone Blue

5 minutes ago, Stone Blue said:

Also, my KSP installs are on a separate partition from my C:\ anyway...

Maybe that's the problem? I know it shouldn't be a problem, but I don't know how KSP would react to a situation like that since it maybe expects to be on the C drive. So, perhaps try putting it on the C drive?

5 hours ago, Stone Blue said:

Came to add that I also am not getting a settings.cfg OR any output_log.txts created, and also saw your post...
Nope... I already had checked all that, thinking the same... Also, my KSP installs are on a separate partition from my C:\ anyway...
I even redownloaded the install package from the KSP website yesterday, just to make sure I had gotten the correct one in the 1st place... \o/

I guess what I really need to know is if I am the only one this is happening to...

I've heard a few reports of issues with KSP on secondary drives, but this was never previously a problem.
